wiki.relatives: Alasdhair Kinross & Lilibet (ancestors), Lord Kinross (father, deceased), Joseph MacTaggert (husband, deceased), Kevin MacTaggert ([[Proteus]], son, deceased), Rahne Sinclair ([[Wolfsbane]], ward)
wiki.abilities: Moira MacTaggert was one of the world's foremost experts in the scientific field of genetics, specializing in the study of superhuman mutants.
wiki.origin: Uncanny X-Men #389 (2001), Excalibur #79 (1994), X-Men #117 (1979), Cable #-1 (1997), Uncanny X-Men #273 (1991), Uncanny X-Men #300 (1993)
wiki.significant_issues: Met Xavier (Uncanny X-Men #389, 2001); engaged to Xavier, broke off engagement (X-Men #117, 1979); met X-Men (X-Men #96, 1976); revealed to have contracted Legacy Virus (Excalibur #79-80, 1994); discovered cure for Legacy Virus, critically injured in attack on Muir Island, imparted cure to Xavier, died (Uncanny X-Men #388/Bishop: The Last X-Man #16/X-Men #108, 2001)
wiki.bio_text: The daughter of a powerful Scottish nobleman. Whilst studying at Oxford University, Moira Kinross was dating Joe MacTaggert when she met and fell in love with graduate student [[Professor X|Charles Xavier]]. In response to the rivalry between Joe MacTaggert and himself for Moira's affections, Xavier enlisted in the United States Army to prove he was as courageous as MacTaggert, who was serving with British forces. Charles continued to see Moira when on leave from a tour of duty with a covert mission in Southeast Asia. Moira promised to wait for him, and promised to marry him. However while Charles was recovering from battlefield injuries, one month before his discharge, Moira broke off their engagement without explanation. She subsequently married Joe MacTaggert. But Joe MacTaggert quickly proved to be a brutal and abusive husband. While on their honeymoon in New York City, MacTaggert severly beat and sexually assaulted Moira, causing her to be hospitalized for a week and leaving her pregnant. From then on, Moira lived apart from her husband, although he refused to grant her a divorce, and she kept the fact that he had a son secret from him for twenty years.
wiki.bio:
The daughter of a powerful Scottish nobleman. Whilst studying at Oxford University, Moira Kinross was dating Joe MacTaggert when she met and fell in love with graduate student [[Professor X|Charles Xavier]]. In response to the rivalry between Joe MacTaggert and himself for Moira's affections, Xavier enlisted in the United States Army to prove he was as courageous as MacTaggert, who was serving with British forces. Charles continued to see Moira when on leave from a tour of duty with a covert mission in Southeast Asia. Moira promised to wait for him, and promised to marry him. However while Charles was recovering from battlefield injuries, one month before his discharge, Moira broke off their engagement without explanation. She subsequently married Joe MacTaggert. But Joe MacTaggert quickly proved to be a brutal and abusive husband. While on their honeymoon in New York City, MacTaggert severly beat and sexually assaulted Moira, causing her to be hospitalized for a week and leaving her pregnant. From then on, Moira lived apart from her husband, although he refused to grant her a divorce, and she kept the fact that he had a son secret from him for twenty years.

Moira forged a brilliant career as a leading geneticist, earning a Nobel Prize, and founded a Mutant Research Center on [[Muir Island]] off the coast of Scotland. After renewing contact with Xavier, they discussed the possibility of establishing a school for training mutants. Moira became Xavier’s silent partner in founding the [[Xavier Institute For Higher Learning|Xavier Institute for Gifted Youngsters]] and its’ first team of mutant students, the [[X-Men]].

When Moira’s son [[Proteus|Kevin]] began to manifest destructive superhuman mutant powers, she attempted to “cure” him, but her efforts were in vain and she was forced to keep him imprisoned. Moira also came to take a young mutant Scottish girl named [[Wolfsbane|Rahne Sinclair]] as her ward, sending her to study at Xavier’s as a member of the [[New Mutants]].

Moira finally met the X-Men while claiming to be their new housekeeper, but they soon learned her true profession. During her affiliation with the X-Men, Moira fell in love with [[Banshee|Sean Cassidy]]. Meanwhile, Kevin escaped Muir Isle and began to possess the bodies of others, draining their life energies to power his ability to warp perceptions of reality. As Proteus, Kevin terrorized the town of Edinburgh and was confronted by the X-Men. Kevin attacked and possessed his father’s body, killing him, before being killed himself by [[Colossus (Piotr Rasputin)|Colossus]].

Moira eventually became the first human to contract the mutant-killing [[Legacy Virus]]. Affiliating herself with the British super-team [[Excalibur]], she dedicated herself to finding a cure for the Virus and eventually found one just as the mutant terrorist [[Mystique]] and her [[Brotherhood of Mutants]] attacked Muir Island. Moira was mortally wounded in the resultant destruction of her Research Center, but she clung on to life just long enough to contact Xavier telepathically and transfer the cure to him. The [[Beast]] then created an antidote from Moira’s research, which was released when Colossus sacrificed his life to disperse the cure into Earth’s atmosphere.
